meanings.def: to decide and state officially in court that somebody is guilty of a crime
examples: be convicted (of something) He was convicted of fraud.
convict somebody (of something) There wasn’t enough evidence to convict her.
He was convicted of a serious driving offence.
He was convicted of the murder of two teenagers.
He was convicted on a drug charge.
She was convicted for her part in the crime.
They were convicted on all 13 counts.

meanings.def: a person who has been found guilty of a crime and sent to prison
examples: The novel begins with Pip’s meeting with an escaped convict from the prison ship.
